sen.j: 日秀（にっしゅう、天文 (元号)3年〔1534年〕 - 寛永2年4月20日 (旧暦)〔1625年5月26日〕）は、戦国時代 (日本)（室町時代後期）から江戸時代初期の女性である。
sen.e: Nisshu (born in 1534 and died on May 26, 1625) was a woman who lived from the Warring States period (in Japan) (the late Muromachi period) until the early Edo period.

sen.j: 大和国の三輪氏の一族と自称する農民の三輪弥介（後の三好吉房）に嫁ぎ、永禄11年（1568年）に秀次、永禄12年（1569年）に秀勝、天正7年（1579年）に秀保を産む。
sen.e: Nisshu married Yasuke MIWA, a farmer who called himself a relative of the Miwa Family in Yamato-no-kuni and renamed himself Yoshifusa MIWA later, and gave birth to Hidetsugu, Hidekatsu and Hideyasu in 1568, 1569 and 1579, respectively.

Nisshu married Yasuke MIWA, a farmer who called himself a relative of the Miwa Family in Yamato Province and renamed himself Yoshifusa MIWA later, and gave birth to Hidetsugu (1568), Hidekatsu (1569) and Hideyasu (1579).

sen.j: 天正19年（1591年）、嫡子豊臣鶴松を亡くした弟の秀吉の元に秀次・秀勝を養子とする。
sen.e: In 1591, Hidetsugu and Hidekatsu were adopted by her younger brother Hideyoshi because Hideyoshi lost his eldest son, Tsurumatsu TOYOTOMI while Hideyasu was adopted by Hidenaga TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: しかし、文禄元年（1592年）、秀勝は文禄の役出陣中に病没した。
sen.e: Thereafter, Hidekatsu died of illness on his way to the front in Bunrokunoeki War (Japan's first invasion of Korea) in 1592.

sen.j: 日秀は出家し、秀次の供養の為京都の嵯峨野（のちに村雲に移転）に瑞龍寺 (近江八幡市)（尼門跡）を建立し、菩提を弔った。
sen.e: Nisshu became a nun and erected Zuiryuji Temple (Omi-Hachiman City as known today) (Ama-monzeki (a temple whose superior has always been a woman born of the imperial family or of the nobility) in Sagano (transferred to Murakumo later) in Kyoto to hold a service for Hidetsugu, and prayed to Buddha for the happiness of him.
sen.cmt: 「京都の嵯峨野（のちに村雲に移転）に瑞龍寺 (近江八幡市)（尼門跡）を建立し」：誤植の疑いがあります。「京都の嵯峨野村雲に瑞龍寺（尼門跡）を建立し (のちに近江八幡市に移転)」ではないでしょうか。一応原文どおりに訳出しました（意味不明な部分があります）。上記の推測が正しければ、訳文は下記のとおりとなります。Nisshu became a nun and erected Zuiryuji Temple, Ama-monzeki (a temple whose superior has always been a woman born of the imperial family or of the nobility), at Murakumo in Sagano, Kyoto (transferred to Omi-Hachiman City as known today) to hold a service for Hidetsugu, and prayed to Buddha for the happiness of him.
sen.e: Nisshu became a nun and erected Zuiryuji Temple in Sagano, Kyoto (Omi-Hachiman City as it is known today). (Ama-monzeki--a temple whose head has always been a female born from the imperial family or from the nobility.) She later transferred to Murakumo. She held a service for Hidetsugu, and prayed to Buddha for his happiness.
